record.attribute: you can add comments to genes and genomic sequences
How do I add comments to genes and genomic sequences?

To add comments you must first login. If you are not registered, it only takes a minute (we ask for minimal info). Once logged in, go to a gene page or genomic sequence page and click "Add a comment."
addComment
you can save your query history
How do I save my query history?
If you are logged in, your query history is automatically saved, and will be there the next time you log in. Registering only takes a minute (we ask for minimal info).
saveHistory
you can combine search results in "My Query History"
How do I review and combine search results?

Go to "My Query History" to see the queries you have run (in your current browser session). From there you can view the results and combine results using AND, OR or INTERSECT. You can also request a tab delimited report of your results.
queryHistory
you can download all annotations
How do I download all annotations?
In addition to fasta sequence files, the download site includes GFF files that contain rich annotation of each gene.
downloadSite
you can download 5'UTR and 3'UTR sequences
How do I download 5'UTR and 3'UTR sequences?

Paste the Gene ID of the sequence(s) of interest into the Sequence Retrieval tool (available from the Queries and Tools page) and set the parameters for the upstream/downstream regions of interest. Try both the selections 'genomic' and 'transcript' since genes may not have UTR's annotated.
sequenceDownloadSRT
you can download your query results
How do I download my query results?

You can link to a page to download and customize a query result from the top of that query result's page or from that query result's entry in "My Query History." Once in the "Create and download a report" page, choose the columns to include in a tab delimited report of the result.
reportMaker
you can retrieve all or part of a gene sequence
How do I retrieve all or part of a gene sequence
Use the "Gene Sequences" link from the home page to retrieve a set of gene sequences in fasta format. Customize the type of sequence and the region you would like to download
SRT
you can hide or show some sections of the Gene page by enabling cookie in your browser
Why are some sections of the Gene page hidden when I go to a new Gene page?

The sections in the Gene page (and in other pages as well) are controlled by the Hide/Show option buttons (in blue text next to each section title). If you have cookies enabled, then these settings are preserved from one gene page to another (during the current browser session). With cookies disabled, moving to a new page will reset that settings.
cookies
you can interpret the definition lines of the download files
How do I interpret the definition lines of the download files?

An example defline is:
>Toxoplasma_gondii|Ib|25.m00004|Tg Annotation|Toxoplasma_gondii_TIGR|(protein coding) SAG2 related antigen SAG2B

The vertical pipes are field separators. There are six fields: the strain, chromosome name, gene name, method of evidence, the sequencing center, and a short definition.
defline
BLASTP results on the Gene Page are generated using WU-Blast
Why do the BLASTP results for a protein on the Gene Page differ from the results from NCBI BLAST?
ToxoDB uses WU-Blast and the filtering of low complexity sequence occurs only during the first pass of the search, not in the alignment phase.
Blast
you can improve the features of the site using cookies
How do I set cookies in my browser to improve the usage of features in the site?

This site performs best when your browser allows cookies. In particular, the Gene page configuration uses cookies. Select show/hide for any section on the gene page. With cookies enabled, that selection will apply to all gene pages. With cookies disabled, moving to a new page will reset that selection

How to Enable Cookies(credit: http://www.google.com/cookies.html)

To enable cookies, follow the instructions below for the browser version you are using.

Mozilla Firefox (1.0 final release and earlier)
  • Go to the "Tools" menu.
  • Select "Options".
  • Select the "Privacy" icon in the left panel.
  • Check the box corresponding to "Allow sites to set cookies".
  • Click "OK" to save changes.
Netscape 7.1/Mozilla 5.0
  • Select "Preferences" from the Edit menu.
  • Click on the arrow next to "Privacy & Security" in the scrolling window to expand.
  • Under "Privacy & Security", select "Cookies."
  • Select "Enable all cookies".
  • Click "OK".
Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0+
  • Select "Internet Options" from the Tools menu.
  • Click on the "Privacy" tab.
  • Click the "Default" button (or manually slide the bar down to "Medium") under "Settings".
  • Click "OK".
Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.x
  • Select "Internet Options" from the Tools menu.
  • Click on the "Security" tab.
  • Click the "Custom Level" button.
  • Scroll down to the "Cookies" section.
  • To enable:
    • Set "Allow cookies that are stored on your computer" to "Enable".
    • Set "Allow per-session cookies" to "Enable".
  • Click "OK".
Microsoft Internet Explorer 4.x
  • Select "Internet Options" from the View menu.
  • Click on the "Advanced" tab.
  • Scroll down to find "Cookies" within the "Security" section.
  • To enable:
    • Select "Always accept cookies".
  • Click "OK".
Netscape Communicator 4.x
  • Select "Preferences" from the Edit menu.
  • Find the "Cookies" section in the "Advanced" category.
  • To enable:
    • Select "Accept all cookies" (or "Enable all cookies").
  • Click "OK".
cookies
